title: Cognitive Load Assessment of Anatomy E-Learning Tools: Application of the Dual-Task Paradigm

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Anatomy Concepts and Experience with E-Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Experimental design and execution to evaluate cognitive load of anatomy e-learning tools in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners will be able to quantitatively measure cognitive load in anatomy e-learning tools using a dual-task paradigm.
Learners will be able to overcome the limitations of the traditional dual-task paradigm by designing auxiliary tasks based on a modified Stroop test.
Learners can analyze the impact of e-learning tool interface design on cognitive load and propose improvement strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
